    subTitle: "Relevance Levels",
    content: `Four phases are split in the diagram shown my understanding of the relevance in a recommending system: 1Ô∏è‚É£ At the begining, we sometimes start from a point with misleading data about users where we generated junk information that push users away. 2Ô∏è‚É£ We reach a point with right data of a user where we can feed them the basic thing. 
      3Ô∏è‚É£ As more interaction involved, we climbed to a position where we can feed them juciy information. 4Ô∏è‚É£ We are getting the point of "information cocoons", where we only give them the information they love. But users could start to loose interest.
        `
  }, {
    isImage: "true",
    url: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AY5H4Phi2-Tqvi_9e35D_vDZz1VMhRoslKm0FkLuuOBX13guC0KjA0ACqw9p49pxxUnYfaGMluP7e1I6aLjd0j0-pRXeRrnpsE8nUx5kMJrQxz2rfJY8LZTrrQAh2JxfNUbCRSGL4Si4RgL83CRWFHQN2W4y9sdbrp-uyHQUhCrDoYXqe2MgZC-lhJrlR22fYUDSf32kL9phTS_vgstj8eSK176frwDoZxlM8vB2_9oTj-ryfefknszqjS-zMR2VZIgwaOQMbzuj2AegOPSa_eDGvKO81ZHe-xNWa7BoOR_wWEQtvf7nn8jt1RJCnR4BAKfbedj_RMx_-NnQWsKvjWLlYOmIw-3orIegfGqrUHwXwm18L23ERjj5A0fdZii1PGMw-vFU-P0L1p7bjWo-duewpu4zZGUc1m5jdloKXah1guaDOps0pm0qCEk-jOzte23WMWLFVPILmgrVlQIQkVCTkm5w6NrRvkqr1wRrqb_N9RIEy3DcqMJFdqmX1PLx1dL6SkByVlz3NC1SHaXp7FQZA3inT7AC9MVhmQYD8tvxmxMylAAyZwWEHE_11fnQ_ZUJRVTMgFHOgNFxmzQ4jCwyYqs8F87QAwRddZJjKaIt45HRc8HVKN6g8y95FI2vghe7IHxbKjK9uwACBLodMD03tkRyIGCHJ9alKS-l4pP7gqLOoX7y0VLwGMAecA=w2732-h1378-no?authuser=0",

      like or dislike example products in the product feed.
      So users can take survey as anytime as they want. Users can correct their preference as they changed their mind. 
      Thus, we can shorten/avoid the time on the phase 1 and quickly reach to the phase 2.
      `

    url: "https://overflow.io/embed/1KWNU3",
    subTitle: "Show 2: ToolTip",
    content: "An overview of my design process. I got a task from PM, Sam Li, in which talked about adding a Cash on Delivery (COD) as a new payment method for users in Malaysia. I then scheduled a meeting with Marketing Manager, Brandon, who won this project, and talk more details about business requirements. To better understand what is the current COD experience in SEA, I conducted user study and gained insights from users."

};

sourcesContent:
import Colors from "../Constant/Colors";
import wishLogo from "../Constant/wishlogo.png"

export default {
  backgroundColor: `${Colors.greybg}`,
  textColor: `${Colors.black2}`,
  frontImage: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/9GRGEJPWXnUS0kxWatbdX5amMV1zgOr1TAlZAI3Ye4Bi1DjwrBLadm6IxsLJC7nGQzPdLMvcWvZSTx12-CeaB5rXjIMKf75ByVcxGwtIxNP1pMDg36lYn3kTOwP290W03io3B_YHReTyGqHh-Ik3J6hljpihi7X-grcoUIiiJquacD4Dhx6Auerf1ZixdjuIhutow7YIZoWFNTJ_AGUssvHrYNcw_GGUJgUCoVUVa7b9BK7baE89lYeHDd4JOCXv97VKwFnYu63zT4IwFmQK2jJOKm60WKR1rRnYZ0quIe3CCOBuEjYFbRgqn2z3ochyippysG2ime05B_tpFJHEaxRSehVrAXpI8QgA1tnr4S6BJzN5wLplmfc2bzERYGzWnsN29jn44V5P-RVeeFFPQGL4uxBAYUMjtp9lSMIYpIrRCc6dp758xPQ4YM3NzdWVtWDIzyBiJpXV85y6Ja0qF9PYgwog01dGfkZ8QX1zpMQAq3EVOHVeYU2jXfFqglwvKYloLgpr7tIoxaxp5Z7lOlct3UKAsRCjnjAYAt5xzItT7lakvuuPwqBGQ8ZrmNYXcEfmwpi2z9Q4msDDeT4N_kdNkDao1k1uBc78H89WarcSkhuWHeRYa8BkakeVRjuGU5X3F8vceA9DbFJbodbnpxXqjIpVvZcfLKiamkqilEpMOVCyYomnUnGUwK6FbQ=w1284-h1826-no?authuser=0",
  heroImage: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/U-fpGgxbfyvkyMPowSB5k_M4IyQWeUKad7uQoLJhAFjzlzdAE_yg1luSzXL8ZKHDbCPGosU1D6M_bSMnLPOdjF2-6nIkuDCyLnzVdCdEMd8xp5pV8Zmhoc6BnceBDVvw6vfB_H5m0YJRepBoxpoFVjoUIVwvKNXH5LX3fRZgN-mCbN2Fdb4MxG8ylamWw-sPDADv0XpO6d2zCT1LZnI2MCGVFfET2h_lrDxQmh706eprj95gtx4BvBWtmIun6yeq-ljTHcfjUq_xnWo44xeYOFnsbML8TT1Xu-N5h5ZsLmMiv-gL5fJe5s1Uc35jr1eRdiDpvdC98c_BUf0Yf0nzuyL5-nuB3HbEjARX5bSX2R7LzPqttpK6jP4wAuYOmrM9ueXKE2vOBDdkn09DYNPDEr2a4oeoIUK0r3ehiZYmlWhD9yEuV9Uu-JEC7ZN_L_xpjKOhzZRcUrLGuoLEHCRNdRa42eGM9gNIRaRACg3e3SOCTZIaD_NqxKzc8_ehPzM-guRSUUwlxKdqbdcMwe5zdyX7Ckmh4IwDJvkpjjnUYB1dU-lpDD-2bsM4A5X2y4AUlngf5qdVLTplduDnnKIgY4Ed7ChVTcOEk-qUZQO7XrP44Do-iiFDqG9Qtdzk4g7un_p_lcRm7hWoSXHEhLz8Cn1fLmXdRIh9OEkzUQ7qH53CB8ln_zS406nRmkhomw=w2650-h1682-no?authuser=0",
  program: wishLogo,

  projectId: "Like or Dislike",
  projectHightlight: "New users can like or dislike the product to improve the relevancy of their initial feed.",
  projectIntro: `As part of New User Experience program, we start to allow new users to like or dislike a selected product 
  in the initial feed to increase the relevancy of their personlized product feed within the first 7d. We belive that we can 
  get initial data about users' shopping preference.
  
  `,
  projectMetrics: [
    "New User Experience", "- DropOff", "+ Unique Buyer Conversion",
  ],
  contributers: [
    {
      name: "Kristina Wang",
      title: "Product Manager @Wish",
      image: "https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C5603AQHPoVWmBkT5bQ/profile-displayphoto-shrink_800_800/0?e=1597276800&v=beta&t=QfOzSoSdjzHczObQtNBuZJjqUJgYcoOw7_18j9FeHV0",
      url: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristinatwang/"
    }
  ],
  contentDetails: [
    {
      isImage: "true",
      url: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u__50G_AzgdveeAfcdJsiDHTc9VqeiwFXnGELfvG4aoFbZxozpg7OE4HxeWSLa-Cz-xEb16HyxO31QEEZXwB9oPyHY0gwzQuBicNJQJBk06xEFeGQW6cDro9n-Rir0WQOjf6jq3LCYrdw0j6350RsCODmvFhxh2fs3mXqDBJViidZdGWmDz67f84HfGgI-yJzCFKO8hRLX6xUOcXsZLOarZFdpBpg0mxAk_7SuBifx1RVaCbLIYiUxInMUGyFvvLQMnYqpq4kia3OK2Dgjz_0pEnbVaw9n0kbF2EJ3FSxz4-07Erx9hkUhLqIFRCDG9mNHWHJgSDjB0_IJIWDcaNeD0x6mw_4Yy-EmIn9yru8irhMlVRb7xGzh1OVGbRCJ4wF16w-VChMVznO7cG8ry1v_u0qo4owYkYXb-8oq5WCWVMXZ0JrWkRSHjnqSbgPS2xgDTgwWDtF9B_n_xpdmc2zWU7lRbi_UkLLJx6NHdVmPcyLf6BI5bM7PTjxdFWOYYFIhKWXv5WOAN_gPO8VeF_lcPLxCqAeDa7TjAYeH-78JT2GC1oXgLgf4uKpcMGnL2VreqBFHecrDSaX-3sIee-MVhitaJjkV0Sv_-KxDOE5upf2GdY59Fo2Ud5VjEn_6Zje5FGvSjftRXS6dqiS42OTtFymtZ7HIUj9vrud_rP4B8X2PxESWax8-PAEgEBvQ=w2378-h1142-no?authuser=0",
      subTitle: "Control & Problems",
      content: `
      In control, new users are asked to select the product they like from a list of example products selected by Wish while onboarding, 
      because we want to use those initial data about user's preference to customize the product feed for them, in which can increase unique buyer conversion. 
      üî¥However, people usually wish to pass the onboarding flow as quick as possible, so they 
      1) skip or drop off the onboarding flow.
      2) choose random products to pass the proccss.
      Finally we end up with no data or misleading data about users' preference.
      ` },
    {
      isImage: "true",
      url: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3Q2auoY_XYTZuuImQ0idWhbkN59oQ_htJC_9hIYfu4ihabtP0bhkG8z6Sm4hVHsE1nxMLIY0wDfnrme3xwIcnVQDv_gmPh5-TEpGqFW9X582SzPXe949sLzVsEC7eTb36jgtqdkAhgQ6sxpCAgKS0n16Kct-KnrhJ0HuxSGmBlxHzGm_YoSj46PuNkqu1UqCrUrFjyTarFyLpx4c359a_DkW2ZbblCpdvCybv85t2ILANOM6GGAd3zAOYIaUMXW5K7hmULzTP9hbOMwfW1EjszilfNGz67P1LTSV2fvNIxgD2riUZfBUDN8L7oUqFcoa8PWEffz0wPPimqJ93M-_inNE63MxgHCBxuFiTSNFJamfGfSsDW9G8DWSrRci8FcUZEmMcXb4qqruEHMDX1BfyO_iHLgW2gxQ-CI5A_uAcYg6gzOGepGB_ujkbC8vOMLeH7_U3IVMupY5K301gwYJY8JHB4S_or0nC_rK_wM6pxXb4SAuN5KTLzsjelsJNcAlW2anflHk_WA4L_d5VpSQKpbCr0jP3UGRg3-t0UoV_sqIQfzSnyrXZLkx6ALNr9OUDy0wp_rPXQjCFCA8nREFYIc6fbGH7LKNRoyRrLGyeziu-EPHuBsfIWnSNFVQuCstXDFrbzWgF8p1tUcZAW-O__D5a3taN8_VQeHXMqJNjrIYKhpJFz6Q8PxLmSgqCw=w2732-h1090-no?authuser=0",
      subTitle: "Relevance Levels",
      content: `Four phases are split in the diagram shown my understanding of the relevance in a recommending system: 1Ô∏è‚É£ At the begining, we sometimes start from a point with misleading data about users where we generated junk information that push users away. 2Ô∏è‚É£ We reach a point with right data of a user where we can feed them the basic thing. 
      3Ô∏è‚É£ As more interaction involved, we climbed to a position where we can feed them juciy information. 4Ô∏è‚É£ We are getting the point of "information cocoons", where we only give them the information they love. But users could start to loose interest.
        `
    },
    {
      isImage: "true",
      url: "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AY5H4Phi2-Tqvi_9e35D_vDZz1VMhRoslKm0FkLuuOBX13guC0KjA0ACqw9p49pxxUnYfaGMluP7e1I6aLjd0j0-pRXeRrnpsE8nUx5kMJrQxz2rfJY8LZTrrQAh2JxfNUbCRSGL4Si4RgL83CRWFHQN2W4y9sdbrp-uyHQUhCrDoYXqe2MgZC-lhJrlR22fYUDSf32kL9phTS_vgstj8eSK176frwDoZxlM8vB2_9oTj-ryfefknszqjS-zMR2VZIgwaOQMbzuj2AegOPSa_eDGvKO81ZHe-xNWa7BoOR_wWEQtvf7nn8jt1RJCnR4BAKfbedj_RMx_-NnQWsKvjWLlYOmIw-3orIegfGqrUHwXwm18L23ERjj5A0fdZii1PGMw-vFU-P0L1p7bjWo-duewpu4zZGUc1m5jdloKXah1guaDOps0pm0qCEk-jOzte23WMWLFVPILmgrVlQIQkVCTkm5w6NrRvkqr1wRrqb_N9RIEy3DcqMJFdqmX1PLx1dL6SkByVlz3NC1SHaXp7FQZA3inT7AC9MVhmQYD8tvxmxMylAAyZwWEHE_11fnQ_ZUJRVTMgFHOgNFxmzQ4jCwyYqs8F87QAwRddZJjKaIt45HRc8HVKN6g8y95FI2vghe7IHxbKjK9uwACBLodMD03tkRyIGCHJ9alKS-l4pP7gqLOoX7y0VLwGMAecA=w2732-h1378-no?authuser=0",
      subTitle: "Idea and Iteration",
      content: `Instead of choosing example products in the onboarding flow, we allow users to 
      like or dislike example products in the product feed.
      So users can take survey as anytime as they want. Users can correct their preference as they changed their mind. 
      Thus, we can shorten/avoid the time on the phase 1 and quickly reach to the phase 2.
      `
    },
